title: Iliad
author: Homer
description: An epic poem recounting the significant events of the final weeks of the Trojan War.

title: Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem describing the ten-year journey of Odysseus after the fall of Troy.

title: Oedipus Rex
author: Sophocles
description: A tragedy about the fate of Oedipus, who unknowingly kills his father and marries his mother.

title: The Knight in the Panther's Skin
author: Shota Rustaveli
description: A medieval Georgian epic poem about a knight's quest for love and honor.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: A Spanish novel about a nobleman who becomes obsessed with chivalric romances.

title: Hamlet
author: William Shakespeare
description: A tragedy about the fate of Hamlet, who seeks revenge for his father's murder.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological novel about a young man who commits murder and struggles with guilt.

title: Brother Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological novel about a young man who commits murder and struggles with guilt.

title: King Richard III
author: William Shakespeare
description: A historical play about the rise and fall of King Richard III.

title: Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An epic poem about the journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel about the French invasion of Russia and the impact of the Napoleonic era on Russian society.
